title: Ping spam.
body:
I really think riot should implement a ping spam filter. Cut you off at 4 pings after that doesn't let you ping again for a while... Maybe 7 seconds or something like that? 

You should never need more than 4 pings. 

These people that compulsively ping everything from minions to random parts of the terrain of no consequence at the rate of a hummingbird on crystal meth really do my head in. 

Makes me want to turn ping volume down to handle the impending migraine, but don't want to miss important pings from those rare people who aren't just accidentally hitting it while mashing there face into the keyboard repeatedly, which is how I'm convinced most people in normals play.

Is there a good reason like something like this shouldn't be implemented? I may be missing something obvious i'm rather tired.

replies.body: you mean like the one there already is?

I don't understand.... there is one in place? That stops people from spamming over and over? I've never noticed but I never ping more than three times. 

When does it cut you off? What is considered spam?

The temporary ban on pinging is the same as the temporary ban on chat when you're in champion select. If ping too many times within a set time period you will be unable to make any pings for about 3 - 5 seconds.
I don't mind ping spam if there's a good reason for it, dragon, incoming gank, etc~
I played a game with some lad who had a macro that spammed pings nonstop the entire game :))))))))))))))))
well you don't need to ping that many times like only three or four and no more than that

> [{quoted}](name=Seasons of Love,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=d7LG5U6v,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-03-18T14:36:59.647+0000)
> You should never need more than 4 pings. 

What game have you been playing? You need about 87 pings just for half of our solo queue teammates to understand that we need to go to Dragon.
I need to spam mia ping so my teammates can't complain about me not calling it.

I only experienced one person who was able to ping constantly in a game in NA before I xfered. he had to have been using some workaround, but he pinged for 25 minutes straight. Non-stop, no breaks. Otherwise i don't care.
I only ping when important objectives need to be secured and what not, but I ping alot when they don't bloody listen or when they don't know when to stop chasing.

I agree that pinging is hugely important to team communication and sometimes you need to get the message across. But surely 4 or maybe 5 is enough? 

Beyond that it starts to enter the realm of the obnoxiously unnecessary and just plain distracting.

Number of times last game where i had a dead Xin Zhao pinging over and over and over on the person I was attacking. It was actually a problem, really distracting,
